hook.text: For people with celiac disease, a single breadcrumb can trigger an immune attack that damages the gut.

buildup.text: Celiac is an autoimmune condition where gluten triggers the immune system to attack the small intestine.

discovery.text: The immune system attacks the villi, reducing the surface area available for absorbing nutrients.

twist.text: Many people live undiagnosed for years. Symptoms range from digestive issues to fatigue and joint pain.

climax.text: The only treatment is a strict lifelong gluten-free diet. Even traces can reignite the immune response.

punchline.text: For 1% of people, gluten is genuinely dangerous.

quiz.question: What does the immune system attack in celiac disease?
